page.title: 03 THE PETRIFIED FOREST.
page.content: The forest is situated at{Hanover {Point}near Brook.At low tide black rock (resembling trees that appeared to have been charred and embedded in clay) can be seen.In many areas of the rock{wooden fibres}are still evident, whereas in other areas the wood has been converted into a substance resembling{the mineral Jet.}All the rock in this area is made up of {fossilised wood }and every detail of the tree structures can be seen. The Georgian naturalist, {Thomas Webster,} described the{"Pine Raft"}as a "beatiful example of the astonishing processes of nature". During the passage of time sea and sand have {eroded}the{Petrified Forest }but enough can be seen at low tide for the visiting tourists to view this spectacle.
